title: Cursor AI Code Editor Fixed Flaw Allowing Attackers to Run Commands via Prompt Injection
description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed a now-patched, high-severity security flaw in Cursor, a popular artificial intelligence (AI) code editor, that could result in remote code execution. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2025-54135 (CVSS score: 8.6), has been addressed in version 1.3 released on July 29, 2025. It has been codenamed CurXecute by Aimâ€¯Labs, which previously disclosed EchoLeak.
